text: Bottle shared at home with Béla and Shonali. Clear yellow colour small white head. Nose is... everything. Fruity acids, low earth, spices. Taste is funky, light sourness, spices, basil, citric notes. Amazing an complex.

Cloudy orange color, medium sized white head with fast retention. Orange aroma, sour, reminds me of a good sparkling wine. Taste is apple, bacteria, medium to heavy sour with tasty sour aftertaste. Thin to medium body, fizzy carbonation.
very nice nose. light lemon, mild funk, hint of salt. well balanced, easy going.

Bu en cours de zythologie. 
Issue d une bouteille de 75cl.
Verre de 15cl.
Couleur blonde dorée beau reflet et belle brillance .
Mousse tenace mais redescend au fur et à mesure .
Au nez : note de acidulé et fruité un peu de sucre au nez , beau nez assez rond .
En bouche : cest agréable est progressive en bouche .
Jai des note acidulé du début à la fin !
Note sucre en agréable en arrière bouche .
Acidité qui révèle un peu de fruit mûre .
Les lambic on bien fait les choses .
Très bonne gueuze.

750 ml bottle. Drank side by side with a 2005-6 vintage Geuze MP. Bright golden color, a bit hazy, with a tall, creamy head. Minerally nose, oranges, bright citrus, some yogurt and lemon. Minerally flavor, green apples, orange. This is much more like a BA American saison than it is like any of the other Boon Geuzes I have tried. I like it, but it is a very different beast, and the aged MP simply towers over it.

W aromacie trochę kwaśno, trochę dziko, trochę owocowo w stylu cytryny czy niedojrzałych białych winogron. W smaku mocno wysycone (dlatego udało mi się ustrzelić dach namiotu i oblać sporo stołu), jest średnio kwaśne, owocowe, w tle trochę skórzanych motywów.

Piwo koloru złotego, lekko mętne z białą szybko znikającą pianą. W aromacie stajnia, owoce cytrusowe, drewno, skóra. W smaku jest trochę kwaśne, cierpkie na początku, goryczkowe, a na finiszu ściągające i jakby pikantne. Pojawia się stajnia, skórka z cytryny, grejpfrut, drewno i skórzany pasek. Ogólnie bardzo fajne piwo. Kwaśnością nie zerwało kamienia z zębów, ale jest jak najbardziej godne polecenia.

Dominuje tu stajnia, która momentami w aromacie wchodziła w nieprzyjemne klimaty tego co w stajni najbardziej śmierdzi, poza tym białe winogrona. Sprawiało wrażenie trochę jednowymiarowego, w dodatku zdecydowanie przegazowane co niestety trochę zabiło dobry odbiór tego piwa. Dużo lepszych podstawowych Oude Geuze jest dobrze dostępnych na rynku.

Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured into a tulip. Translucent orange with medium white head. Aroma is citrus, medium body, well carbonated, and some small-bubble lacing. Taste is nice tart citrus and some yeast.

Bottle. Pours clear copper golden with a small, frothy off-white head. Lots of bubbles. Aroma has lovely Gueuze notes, funk, soft lactic, apple, apricot peel, good oak. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite oily mouthfeel. Flavour has good funk, quite a bit of apple, orange zest, bergamot, sourness is actually kinda subdued. Good, oaky very dry finish. Very elegant.

Geuze veramente molto buona e acida. Al naso me la sarei aspettata più sporca, ma va bene così.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 75cl. Small white head. Hazy orange fruit color. Aroma is nettles, citrus, fruits, rhubarb. Taste is lovely sour.

A: Rotten green apple, acid, fruity
AP: Yellow, slightly cloudy with small white foam
T: The rotten green apple, acid,
P: Light body, high carbonation.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Liors. Thanks Lior. Clear-to-hazy amber, white head. Lactic, slightly funky, yogurt and then earthy notes in the nose. Very sour, very funky, a little barfy taste. Full body, very carbonated, very acidic finish.

0,75 l bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki (tasted April 14, 2017). Appearance is golden, cloudy, bubbly and huge head. Boons geuze is more than just sour, very smooth to drink. I found rhubarb and wood - taste of the oak casks. Excellent.

Bottlepour at Brauhaus. Hazy golden, white head. Nose is dryish, leather, grapes, light vinous, tart. Tastes dry tart fruits, vinous grapes notes, tart apples, barnyard, lingering dry tartness. Solid Boon.

appearance:  clear light straw, fizzy white head quickly vanishing.  aroma: tart lemon, horsey funk, popcorn, light bubblegum, yeast, and wet wood  taste: lemon and grapefruit tartness up front, with funky yeast notes, some pepper, green apple, tart funky brett notes.  finish: 	super dry, light palate, finishes all too quickly. notes: Wow, what a geuze. Dry, tart, refreshing, and funky. Really dry. Really, really dry.  Bottle from the Rare Beer Club.

Bottle. Aroma- very fruity, with a delicate wild notes and subtle sourness. Yellow, with a medium, white head, which quickly falls down. Taste- again nice, Belgian fruits, with balanced sour notes and low wild ones. Nice wooden note in the aftertaste. Medium high carbonation, medium-low-bodied. Tasty, but I would prefer more aggressive Guess.

Żółciutkie, piana szybko opada. Idealnie zbalansowane, kwaśność nie jest zbyt wysoka, taniniczność dosyć szczątkowa, końska derka teź. Ocena na podstawie notatek pisanych przed założeniem konta na RB.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2017 Pretty true to the style here, no surprises. Full farmers aroma, taste balances off without being overly sour. Perhaps the only complaint could be more carbo than necessary for the style

As Boon / Mikkeller Boon Oude Geuze, Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection (7% alc.). Corked 75 cl bottle, served in stemmed glass at La Tape, Madrid. Pours sparkling hazy dark amber, frothy long-lasting tawny head. Aroma is cider, green apples, wild yeast, red berries, bread, a hint of spearmint, smoke, cured meat. Taste is very dry, fizzy, quite salty, great sourness. Medium lasting finish with no bitterness whatsoever. Oh yeah!
Pale blond with lasting head and solid carbonation. Aroma and flavour have light dryness. Very clean. Chalky. Moderately tart.

Bottle. Clear light golden pour with a white head. Big horse blanket bouquet. Crisp with champagne carbonation. Mild horse blanket and barnyard highlights. Oak and barrel backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.
Batch 1 bottle. Cork blew off the bottle. Overcarbonated pepper and Parmesan cheese nose. Vegetal flavor. Wet leather light body.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Liors place. Thanks Lior. Slightly hazy golden with big bubbly white head. Yeasty aroma with notes of candy, some dust, spices and minerals. Very spicy flavor, sour, yeasty with notes of grains, herbal tea, bitterish, very dry. Very carbonated, medium-bodied. Excellent.

750ml bottled 2016. Pour pale orange a bit hazy with nervous bubbles and a white foam. Aroma if from the funky acidity, wood, citrus and light malt. Taste if from nuts shell, green apple, brett (Barn) and fruity. Medium body and high carbonation. Dry and smooth. Long tart and fruity finish.
Pours golden, opalescent, big head, some lacing. Barn, hay, grapes, bretts, white fruits,basement, leather . Sour, dry, some alcohol. Medium body, fizzy, long finish.

Orange, sedimentflagor, lite skum. 
Doft: Citron, bitande funk, torr, papper, avlopp.
Smak: Citron, funk, halm, torr, försvinner fort, syrlig eftersmak.
Starkt kolsyrad, skummar mycket. 
För mycket funk för min smak.

Bottle sample at a tasting, thanks Lior. Hazy orange golden with a huge head. Funky, barnyard, brett, lacto, berries, citrus aroma. Sour flavors with berries, lacto, yogurt, apricots, citrus notes. Medium-bodied, lively carbonation, dry finish. Great and tasty.

Zapach intensywny, słód, zboże, stajnia, cytrusy, jabłka. Kolor złoty, mętne. Piana obfita, drobno i średniopęcherzykowa, trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia kwaśność, średnia pełnia, jabłka, cytryny, stajnia, drewno, zboże. Goryczka niska, wysycenie wysokie.

Aromat: kwaśność na pierwszym planie, dalej trochę bretów pod postacią lekkich nut stajennych i końskiej derki, w miarę ogrzewania wychodzi aromat wina
Wygląd: barwa złota, silne zmętnienie, piana wysoka, biała, średniopęcherzykowa, dosyć trwała, zostawia taki sobie lacing
Smak: kwaśny, lekko wodniste, cytrusowe, głównie pod postacią dojrzałych pomarańczy, przyprawowość, goryczka niska, szlachetna, cytrusowa
Podniebienie: raczej lekkie, nagazowanie bardzo wysokie, bardzo pijalne, orzeźwiające

Bottle sample at a tasting at Lior Ds place. Thanks Lior D.. As "Boon / Mikkeller Oude Geuze Boon, Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection". Golden color. Big funky aroma, cobwebs, wood, oak, fruitiness, lemon. Sour flavor, funky, citric, oaky. Lively carbonation, spritzy. Great stuff.

Bottle shared at home. 2nd edition. Somewhat hazy golden with white head. Sweet malts, light metallic, dough, hay, sour grain, white grapes, minerals. Light sweet and mild sour, light bitter, hints of salt. Under medium body and lots of soft bubbly carbonation. Horsepoop with sugarcubes. Lovely. "Maag t is geus ent verdient nen punt meeg."

Bottle at Hundholmen, Bodø. Pours a clear amber colour with a relatively big off-white head. Aroma of barnyard, vinegar, rowanberries, forest floor and apricot. The flavor is similar but is more sweet with peaches and citrus. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body and a light bitterness. A well-balanced and both fruity and sour gueuze.
UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Goede geuze met groeneappelaroma en azijn in de neus. Appel, champagne en wat graan in het smaakpalet. Mooie droge geuze.
Big bottle. Stinky golden geuze. Sour and tart but not overwhelming, delicious. Still not my favorite style but this is the best example Ive had yet. Great.

750ml corked and caged green bottle. Cork rocketed off and made a mark on the ceiling. This might be my favorite geueze ever, very tart and bright, funky, but not overly so, lots of lemon and classic geueze character. Effervescent, brilliant stuff.

750ml bottle at Beerfox Riga. Pours clear golden, medium sized white head stays. Aroma is grassy, acidy, green apples, vinegar. Taste is sour at first, green apples, lime, some vinegar. Very refreshing, not sour, aftertaste. Well balanced, fizzy carbo, medium body. Amazing!

Barwa złota, umiarkowanie mętne. Aromat to w pierwszym rzędzie agrest, później winogrona oraz cytryna. Nuty skórzane raczej delikatne do umiarkowanych, słabo piwniczne, lekko funkowe, fajne siano, delikatna brzoskwinia. Smak półwytrawny, umiarkowanie kwaśny. Finisza lekko ziemisty, lekko-wytrawny, lekko funkowy z delikatną słodycza oraz ziołową goryczką na samym końcu. Ciało średnie, faktura wodnista, wysycenie wysokie.
W aromacie agrest, zielone jabłko, ziemistość i skóra. Smak wyraźnie kwaśny i przyjemny. Bardzo fajne
Pours amber with medium white head. Aroma is old hay, silage, some vinegar, grass, herbs, old leaves. Taste is grassy, bitter, herbs, silage, horse blanket, strong salt. Super beer!

OSlightly hazy pale yellow with lots of white head. Really nice and complex aroma. Sour apples and cornflakes are the best descriptors of what I pick up in the aroma. The taste is very acidic and slightly salt. Not much sweetness or bitterness. Very dry and slightly astringent palate. Very high carbonation. A little too high to my taste. Can only take very small sips. But a very nice geuze non the less. The aroma is particularly awesome I think.
It is a better balanced version of Mariage Parfait. It is more sour than bitter, better carbonation and lacing. Very close to a champagne. Good.
Zapach nieco octowy, ale przy tym owocowy, świeży. W smaku sporo kwasowości, siano, goryczka wyraźna, ale nie na pierwszym planie. Spore, przyjemne wysycenie.
750ml 7% ABV bottle from Coppers, Newcastle. Hazy golden coloured with a large white head of foam. It has a tart cide-apple, citric flavour with spicy and sour fruit on the very dry finish. Good.
Säuerlicher Peachpeeburner mit ausgesprochener Citrusfreshness. Klatschosamtospektakel mit gute Laune Atmo :) :) :) ...0,75/10Euro. BEYOND BEER HH. Bottle.
Bottle @ home. Mikkeller edition. Haze amber. Small head. Fine citrus Lemon lime. Some fresh hay. Boone dry ;). Tannin. Low sourness. Like it. Frank the Bottle myself. So very drinkable.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 Flaska från SB, ca 2 år gammal. 1st edition, 7% abv. Provning med Nerikes Ölsällskap. Ren, klar guldig med högt vitt skum. Förvånad över hur mycket kolsyra det var i den. I doften konstigt nog något nötig som mest påminner mig om sesam- och honungskakor. Även äppelsyra och grön vindruva. Kroppen tyvärr väldigt snabbt försvinnande, luftig. Skummar snabbt i munnen och försvinner sedan. Det jag hinner känna är att den är snustorr, vilket gärna hade fått hänga kvar längre. Smakmässigt medelsyrlig, grön vindruva, noterbar torr beska, gräsig, grönt humle och citron. Höga förväntningar på denna, men tycker tyvärr den går ner sig rejält pga kroppen. Annars är det mycket som stämmer med denna.

Aroma: Wild aroma, barnyard. Appearance: High head, golden body. Taste: Very astringent, stones, fruity, grapes, wild, mediumly sour, tanins. Palate: High carbonation, very astingent finish, medium-low body.
Pale yellow, big white head. Aroma: fruity, funky, wild. Taste: mild wilderness, dryness, unripe white fruits, funky notes. High carbonation.
Fruity, citrus, un-ripe greengage, hay-ish smooth velvet funk, medium pediococcus sourness - balance towards the acid, a bit edgy and aggressive, tart.
Cork came out like it was fired out of a cannon. Heavy funk, hint of rubber. A bit of citrus pith. Super dry, faint acidity.

Bottled from Systembolaget as Boon/Mikkeller
Hazy golden eith a large, fizzy, white head. 
Tart and citric in both aroma and flavour. 
Lemon-zest, lime, yuzu. 
Very fizzy mouthfeel.

75cl Bottle @ 2D2Dspuma Tienda, Barcelona, Spain.
Hazy golden colour with a tall white frothy head.
Aroma is oak, grapefruit, apple.
Taste is apple, malt, tart, lime.
Medium body, high carbonation.
Super-dry.

second edition bottle bb 12/4/36 deep golden hazy good head grapefruit cellar wood brett light floreal
 oro carico velata buona schiuma buona persistenza un filo grossolana cantina pompelmo secca acidita elegante legno bretta leggero floreale

75cl bottle(7% ABV)
 Aroma is sour fruity 
 Pours a light golden yellow white frothy head that dissipates quickly
 Taste is very sour with lemon notes long dry finish
 nice geuze good sourness

Hazy orange, dense persistent white head.
Brett, kumquat, green apple.
Shockingly dry at the beginning, some sips later I started to love it. Very refreshing bitterness on the back of the palate.
Good one, without any flaws, nice aroma and taste, not too acidic, nie bretts. And the price ;)

UPDATED: JAN 30, 2017 75cl bottle @BierCab, Barcelona. 21-06-2016.
Very nice gueuze. intense flavours, milder in nose. Quite dry finish.

75cl @Sr. Lúpulo., Gijón. 10-12-2016.
Good stuff

Rating #4600, 750ml bottle from Savor Growl ($15): murky gold pour with huge bubbly white head. aroma of funky horse blanket, leather, citrus. tastes are moderate sour, peach, wheat, lemon, background pepper, oak, sulfur vibe. high carbonation. dry finish.
0,75l bottle from the flagship Alko. Pours cloudy orange with a high but quick head. Aroma is sour malts with vinegar and apples. Flavor is sour malts, vinegar, apples. Great balance.
Bottle. hazy golden color, medium white head. Aroma has green apple, light sulphur. Taste is tart vinous apple. Very sour.

Kolor: jasnozłoty, zamglony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, sycząca, ale trwała.
Zapach: sporo aromatów dzikich, końskiej derki, owocowych, czarnej porzeczki.
Smak: lekkie, wytrawne, wyraźne dzikie nuty, spora cierpkość, taniniczność, kwaśność na średnim poziomie, goryczka dość wyraźna, potęgowana przez taniny.
Wysycenie: średnie.

75 cl, bottled. Pours hazy orange with a minimal white head. Aroma: Tart berries, leather, oak. Fermented aroma. Taste: Medium sweet, berries and fruits. Tart taste. Leather, wood. Palate: Medium body, notable carbonation. Pleasantly tart finish.

Had this as the Mikkeller Boon combo. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma is funk and vinegar and the like. Taste is very bretty with some earthiness and the like. Tangy funkiness. Nice finish. Really noce.

Flaske 750ml fra Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Drukket i hyggelig selskap under Storflaskesesjon på Nerstranda 5 Nov 16. Åpner med et lite smell. Lett uklar. Filmskum. Krydderaroma med innslag av gjær. Mye kullsyre. Smaken litt banan. Svakt syrlig. Kjedelig.

Clear golden collour, head explodes and then reduces to a small crown. Good lace. Smell of grapes, lemon, theres some horse blanket too, acidity, pepper. Medium body, carbonation is real good, you can see the bubbles coming up. Taste of lemons, grapes, cellar, cheese?, fruits. Acid but not the most acid gueuze. Very good, pleasant beer.

UPDATED: DEC 11, 2016 Medium white head golden clear coloured body, yeasts fruity grape bubble co2 smell, high co2 dry fruity grape acid sour a bit like a ?cava? low bitter wood oak like taste very complex

Bottle shared with Pix at Mort Subite, Altrincham. Blond with a white head. Really funky sour farmyard aroma. The taste is rich with lots of funk, lemon citrus, hay and spice. Creamy mouthfeel. Superb.

Hazy golden color with a white head that quickly dissapears. Aroma has vinegar notes, barnyard, some citrus and slightly peach. Flavor with a high presence of vinegar notes, tarty, yeasty, slightly notes of white wine and barnyard. Fruity final with a high carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Ben! This was a first for me. I took off the cage and turned around to toss it when I heard a POP! and the cork went bouncing off the ceiling and around the room. No damage done, but it was good for an adrenaline dose for sure. After that, we got down to beer. Surprisingly no gushing after that performance, but it did pour with a pretty large, quickly diminishing, fizzy white head. Orange in color, mostly clear, minimal residual or lacing remains from all of that initial head. Aroma is classic gueuze; barnyard funky yeast, earthy sweat socks. Flavor is dry dry dry, light tart, pretty funky, no cheese but lots of sweat sock. Light body, soft carbonation. Tasty beverage.

Bottle from Mane. This shit is Gods juice. So acidic and linear. Super citric with lemon pith and almost that acetic lemon drive right down the middle of the palate. Have drunk too many of these already. Never want it to end
Jahas. Omppusiideri tjsp. Tuoksu vähän hyökkää, ummehtunut, mutta raikas - outo. Hapan, hapokas, siiderimäinen maku.

750ml Bottle bought at Le Saint-Bock, Montreal, Quebec, Canada. It was under the name Mikkeller Oude Geuze Boon, Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection.
Clear golden color body, with a white head. High carbonation. Smells sourness for sure, funky, barnyard and horse blanket. Earthy, herbal notes and great sourness, pretty dry not much sweetness left from the fermentation.
Hazy orange, fluffy white head. Tart fruit; orange, pineapple. Faint barnyard. Medium body, well carbonated.

Bottle @ Novare Res. Last beer of the trip. A good choice in my opinion. Hazed orange beer with a tall, soapy white head. Funk dominates. Lots of leather, basement, and mushroom. Has plenty of lemon juice, green grape, and tart berry. Theres a really nice apricot note, too. Full carbonation gives this a really great mouthfeel. Has a definite mineral character to it as well. Really nice.

Aroma: leather, pineapple, barnyard, tart apple
Taste: light sour, pineapple, apple, light leather

W aromacie przyjemnie dziki, owocowy, najbardziej stajenny z degustowanych. W smaku bardzo gładki, raczej niski poziom kwaśności, elegancka dzikość, przebłyski owocowości, cytrusów, goryczka niska. Bardzo pijalne!

Aromat to mieszanka soczystych cytrusów (głównie cytryna) i nut rustykalnych, tutaj kojarzących się z suchym sianem czy starym odleżałym, suszonym drewnem. 
W smaku piwo jest wytrawne, z umiarkowaną kwaśnością, która wraz z cytrusowymi posmakami od razu narzuca na myśl cytryny. Goryczka niska, finisz lekko cierpki.

Bottle at home, Big Bottle event with the Beast, 11th November 16. Pours hazy straw colour. Aroma is funk, cellar, typical lambic character. Taste is tart, dry, undertones of sweet, Apple, must, cellar. Not much sign of the ABV, very good.

750ml cork and wire bottle, 7 % abv, as Boon / Mikkeller Oude Geuze Boon bought at Vinmonopolet Tromsdalen. Big white head fading over a hazy, warm golden coloured body. Inviting spiced fruity smell, backdrop of cheese. Mixed mid-tart flavours of wood, cheese and lemon. Yeasty, dry, tart tail. Refreshing and tasty without being a favourite (Big bottle session with Jan Erik, Elisabeth, Stefan and Finn, Tromsø 05.11.2016).

Thanks to erzengel for sharing! Pours a clear golden yellow with a hint of haze and a white cap. The smell is rustic barrel funk, some lemon and yeast. The taste is yeasty, funky lemon on the finish as it smooths out. Light/medium in body with very active carbonation.

7% bottle from Rudat. Grainy horse blanket nose. The beer starts highly carbonated, sourish with woody hints. The higher alcohol is there, refreshing though with a nice sourness left there. The aftertaste is long and sourish grainy, nice horse blanket, fruity with only hints of grain. Voluminous in body, round and fresh with not too much sweetness here.
erilainen aromi, fun palate, ei tällä känniä joisi. Joku sekoitus mainittu.
Fľaa. Zlata farba, biela slaba pena. Vona kysla, slana, jemne ovocna, zelene hrozno. Chut ma bavi. Sladko-kyselkava, citrus, jemne jablko. Velmi dobra dochut. Stredne telo, vyssia nasytenost.
Bottle at Brouwerij Boon. Pours golden color, white head. Aroma of oak, some citrusy fruits. Taste is sour, bret, wood, ash.

Pours hazy golden with a massive frothy white head that quickly settles. Aromas of farmhouse, funk, minerals, soil, green apples, green grapes. Taste is very funky and earthy with some herbal notes. Mouthfeel is crisp and dry and light bodied with medium carbonation.

Porównanie pierwszej warki Black Label z blendem Mikkela. Wnioski - bardzo podobne piwa :) Dzikie i mineralne, wysoko wysycone, musujące, pełne skórzanych posmaków, z sympatyczną, ułożoną kwasowością.

Aroma - has sour, must, dry white flesh fruit, sweat, and funk.
Appearance - the body is relatively clean goldenrod, with bountiful nucleation. The head is white and around 1 1/2" and settles slowly.
Taste - has a mixture of sour, funk, and dry white fleshed fruit and a certain grapefruit. The funk is high - horse blanket, there is a certain cellared cheese about it as well. Barnyard for sure.
Palate - body is on the lighter side, texture is vinous, the carbonation is lively, the finish dry, sour, and funky.

Bottle. Hazy golden color with quite thick white head. Aroma is quite tart and has some sour apple, barnyard and funky elements. Taste is sour with long fruity, sour and dry aftertaste. Flavors of sour apples, funky elements, vinegar and white grapes.

F: big, light off-white, very good retention.
C: orange to gold, hazy, opaque.
A: malt, spicy, barnyard, brett, horse blanket, peach, lemon, apples, funky, woody, basement, complex and great.
T: malt, tart fruity, lemon, lime, apples, woody, farm house, barnyard, hint of peach, funky, sour vinegar, hint of lactic, brett, very complex and balanced, medium body, lively carbonation actually over-carbonated, for 4,75 great deal, must to bay more for cellaring, 7% ABV, batch 75 205, BB: 27/03/2035, 75cl bottle from Prik&Tik/Quali-drinks/ in Brussels.

75cl bottle all to myself. Pours hazy gold with a large persistent white head. Aroma is fresh fruit orchard funk. Taste is crisp with lovely exotic fruits, tart green apple, the lightest whisper of funk. Beautifully balanced.
Harmonizado com talharini, camarão ao alho, tomate, cogumelos e salsa. Pouca diferença da Boon normal.

750mL bottle from Greenwood Gourmet. Aromas of caraway seed, sesame breadsticks, floral, lime, hay. Hazy light orange with a mostly lasting off-white head. Dry, funky, tart, limey. Medium bodied, prickly.
7%, 750ml bottle, batch 60803. Pours hazy orange with big white head. Lively carbonation. Yeasty with some fruits. Winelike. Heavy sourness.

Pours almost clear deep gold with a huge (but short-lived) white head. Rich, seductive aroma of meadows, wild strawberries, citrus, earth, soured cucumber, funk and all happy things. Crispy dry taste and palate, no excessive body/sourness/astringency. Not absolutely bone-dry, but it gains amazing drinkability instead. Definitely one of my favourites.

Bottle--thanks sea bass! Complex pickle juice and sweet white grape aroma with a little burnt match sulfur and stone fruit accents. Almost clear copper and very effervescent under a huge, rocky, white cover. Sour flavour with apricot and other stone fruit, as well as light pickle juice, white grapes, and cranberry. Light body, high carbonation, very clean.

Sample, green bottle, 750 ml, batch #53602, best before 26.03.2035, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savoured on May 14 2016; eye: golden, hazy, tan head that turns into a ring, no lacing; nose: acidity, sourness, green apple, Brettanomyces yeast, musk; mouth: acidity, sourness, green apple, Brettanomyces yeast, musk, short finale in green apple with presence of acidity, medium body, average carbonation, slick texture; overall: fine
 
FRANÇAIS
 
Échantillon, bouteille verte, 750 ml, lot #53602, meilleure avant 26.03.2035, via Philippe Boutin (merci!), savourée le 14 mai 2016; il : dorée, voilée, mousse fauve qui se transforme en un anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : acidité, aigreur, pomme verte, levure Brettanomyces, musc; bouche : acidité, aigreur, pomme verte, levure Brettanomyces, musc, finale courte en pomme verte avec présence dacidité, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, texture coulante; en résumé : bien
Hazy, topaz with pillowy white head. Metal, horseblanket aroma with horseblanket, rust and tang notes followed by lush wheaty finish with final drying out. Wow, thanks Ken for sharing.

The orange color. Nice, but low foam. Aroma: sweet, fruity, citrus, peach, pear, green apple and leather. Funky notes hidden and very subtle. Taste: at the beginning of slightly sour, astringent, fruity, then the more sweet. Finaly beer is semi dry. Very complex, excellent beer.

DWF; Bottle 750ml, drunk at Melkebaren. Batch #: 54302. Pours large, hazy gold with a moderate lasting white head. Nose is sour, apple, citrus, yeast, barn and spice. Taste is moderate sweet and heavy sour with a lasting light spice finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is lively.

Hazy orange colour, small head. Aroma ios tart and sour wooden notes with mild funk and yeasty notes to it. Flavour is fruity, some tart and sour berryish and wooden notes as well as some funk to it. Nicely dry palate.

75cl bottle. Hazy pale orange with a nice white head. Peach, tart, wood, barnyard, citrus and green apples in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is complex with tart, fruity and bitter notes. Long dry finish. Overall, a very good beer.

(Bouteille provenant de Bine & Vine): Visuellement superbe avec une mousse tenace et moelleuse même une heure après louverture. Un twang de conifère épicé sébat dans une base céréalière étoffée et aérienne. Plus entier quune Gueuze mais avec la même verte vivacité.

Bottle, batch 53602, as Boon / Mikkeller Oude Geuze Boon, Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection. Pours hazy golden, with an enormous creamy head receding to a two finger thickness. Aroma is tart hay and citrusy notes, farmhouse and bretty wood and floral notes. Medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour is tart with hay, lemon, farmhouse, earthy notes and bretty floral and wooden notes. Lingering, dry finish.

750ml bottle, sold as Mikkeller Bone Dry. Slightly hazy orange body with a medium head. Barnyard, citrus, fruit. Expected it to be really dry due to the name but it wasnt. Semi sweet for its style actually, but rather pleasant.

Appear: Hazy, yellow, goldish. 
Aroma: Green sour apple, blackcurrant, woodish and funky.
Taste: Quite much sour apple. Blackcurrant leaves behind.
Very dry and pretty nice.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2017 Bottle, as Oude Geuze Boon - Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection. Hazy yellow in colour, no head. Aroma of grapes, green apples, tart fruits, leather, wood. In taste very dry, sour with grapes, white whine, ripe fruits notes. Finish is dry, sour and woody. Light body, high carbonation. Very tasty, fruity, very dry, balanced really well.
Bottle, as Boon Black Label. Less dry than Boon/Mikkeller, more body, bit more sweetish too, still really good but bit different than B/M. Me - I prefered more dry and tart one.

Bottle shared by Tmoney99 from notes. Pours a hazy golden color with a medium sized fizzy off white head. The aroma and flavor have tart lemony citrus, lactic acidity, funk, wood, yogurt, pretty solid offering.

Pullo @ Alko. Kaatuu tulpaaniin kullankeltaisena ja sameana, todella muhkealla, mutta katoavalla vaahdolla. Hiilihappoja tuntuu löytyvän. Tuoksussa tallimaisuus on hyvin vahvaa, nahkaakin on reilusti. Alla on happaman viinimarjaista tuntua, hyvin hapan omena(viinietikka) tulee myös mieleen. Maku alkaa hyvin happaman marjaisena ennen kuin nahkaisuus ottaa alaa. Hapan omena on myös mukana, lopussa tuntuu vehnän tuoma viljaisuus. Suutuntuma on hapan ja melko kuiva, mutta loppu on hieman tyhjä. Kuivan hapan gueuze, nahkaisuus on se hallitsevin elementti, hapan marjaisuus siinä tukena. Hapan tuntuma olisi saanut kestää hieman pitempään.

Proefglas op Lambic & Sour Ale Sunday 2016 te Vichte. U: Wazig strogeel met witte schuimkraag. U: Groene appels, licht funky en wat hout. S: Zurig, groene appeltjes, doet me denken aan champagne. Zeer droge afdronk. M: Sterke carbonatie. Zeer lekker!

Het schuim komt onmiddellijk wanneer je de fles opent. Goudkleurig tot amberkleurig bier met grote witte schuimkraag. Geur: een mooie samenhang van geuren, met vooral agrum en essence van roze pompelmoes. Smaak: malse zurigheid, verse oogstappels, pompelmoes. Romig mondgevoel. Veel sprankelende koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: droog, licht zuur.
Hazy. Apple. Great geuze. Easy for starters. Not too heavy sour. Balanced. Wineish and yeasty as usual. Bubbly, carbonated. Acidy.

Golden yellow beer with nice head on top. Aroma has green apples, some yeast and tart. Taste is sour but not overkill, quite pleasant sour note with green apples and yeast. Medium body and high carbonation. Pleasant gueuze which has balance.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android
Bottle via PUBR. Hazy copper pour with fluffy, white head. Nose was tart light fruit, lactic acidity. Tastes tart, with lemony fruit notes, funk, yeast, cobwebby esters.
Bottle, shared at RBAG by dresden. Cloudy orange gold, high carbonation. Elastics, cheese, feet, leather, old straw, super-dry!! Fantastic gueuze.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Po przelaniu tworzy się sycząca, gruba piana, która szybko opada do postrzępionych chmurek. Barwa złota, opalizująca, na dnie butelki osad. W zapachu zielone winogrona, jabłka, białe wino, skóra, stare drewno i odrobina kiszonki... W smaku wytrawne, dość kwaśne, lekko cierpkie. Podobnie jak w aromacie sporo tu winogron, białego wina, tarniny, niedojrzałych jabłek, w tle nuty dzikie i taniny. Goryczka niska, pestkowo beczkowa. Wysycenie wysokie, drobne, musujące, fajnie ukryty alkohol.
Profil wytrawny i kwaśny, nieco mniej dziki, ogólnie podobny smakowo do Hanssens Oude Gueuze, tylko zdecydowanie przyjemniejszy aromat i posmaki.

750 ml bottle from Systembolaget. Cloudy golden with a large white head. Moderate tart aroma, wood, funky yeast and pilsnermalt. Taste reflects the aroma. Medium body. High carbonation. Low bitterness.

750 ml bottle. Hazy yellow colour, soapy white head. Dryish fruity aroma, with apples and citrus, wood and leather. The flavour is tart, with lemon and apples, peppery and woody notes, a hint of cherries.

UPDATED: FEB 3, 2017 W aromacie dzikość, końska stajnia, cytrusy, zielone jabłko. Zbalansowana kwaśność, owocowość. Goryczki brak ale jest wytrawna końcówka. Bardzo dobre, świetnie ułożone. Chce się więcej
Lambiek-zurig aroma met een houtige toets. De smaak is zacht zurig met een beetje fruitigheid. De afdronk is droog-zurig.
Bottle 0,75litr with cork wich shoot like bullit from the bottle. Slightly hazy orange colored blend with an pretty dry sour taste, great hints of sour apples mostly and some other fruits.

Bottle C&C. Poured hazy amber color with an average frothy off-white head that was lasting with good lacing. Moderate to heavy sour yeast and citrus aroma. Medium to abundant body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium to heavy sour citrus flavor with a medium to heavy sour & sweet finish of moderated to long duration. This is a standout beer.

75cl bottle. Hazy with dirty orange color and huge head. Aroma is typical for a lambic fruity unripe grapes, berries, apples. Also some sauerkraut and lemon juice. Tart, hey, grains and barnyard. Strong carbonation and soft texture. The beer is dry with notes of wood and unripe apple. But above all it is sour with lemon juice notes and unfortunately sauerkraut. This is the kind of sourness my stomach cant handle. Pity. The beer is quite complex but extreme.

Bottle to tulip
Consummation: Here, horsey, horsey, horsey. Give me that blanket. Have some lemon...fresh lemon. 
Adjunct: Horse blanket funk, lemon, candy; I got the dregs, so this is thick, hazy orange
Thanks Pat! Orange golden, aroma is funk, leather, light grape. Funky light carb, light acedic, really interesting and delicious.

750mL bottle, sent from yourilevesque (thanks a lot, Youri!), pours a cloudy opaque bright orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out a lovely barnyard funk character upfront, followed by leather and champagne. Flavour is intense, with bone dry barnyard funk and leather upfront, with a very champagne-y feeling in the mouthfeel. Aggressive as hell on the palate, which makes it a bit difficult to drink much at a time, but also enhances the complexity. Fantastic stuff.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2017 Bottle at Mother Kellys with the Mikkeller label. Nice grapefruit and minerals, dry.... Gooseberry, nice spritziness, good stuff, but possibly not in the best shape to rate it. Another time with the Boon label. Lovely floral aroma, taste is great, lightly sour, nice tartness, bit creamy, soft and delicious. Same score!

Bottle at Cafe Sara, may 16th 2016. Hazy orange body with a big white head. Aroma is funky with leather and citrus fruits, taste of tangerine, peppers, apple skin, dry and sour palate. Fresh sour berry aftertaste with wood notes. Nice.

Pours opaque golden yellow with a large and firm white head which lingers for a while. Aroma is green apples, funk, wet hay. Taste is green apple tart, funk, slightly peppery, green grape sweet (slight). Dry finish.

750 cl, as Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection, batch #53602, best before 26.03.2035. Hazy warm yellow, huge white head, dissipates quickly leaving no lacings but a ring on the surface. Aroma is very fruity on the sour and tart side, citrus, funk, slight rhubarb, grassy. Taste is moderately sour, going into tartness, citrus, green apples, grapes, very dry and tart in the finish. Medium body, medium to high carbo. Perhaps not the most complex of gueuzes, but very balanced and thirst quenching. Perfect to seafood.

Courtesy of Jaghana. Couleur cuivrée trouble, très légère mousse. Nez typique acidulé, fruits verts. Gout fort acidulé, fruits verts avec du boisée allumette. note citronnée, pomme verte, champagne. Superbe, jadore!

Pour from bottle. Nose is huge grapefruit, straw, citrus peel, some cheese rind, really fresh actually. Palate is soft, really well balanced, with lemon, seltzer, hints of wheat, funk. Really nicely drying, clean. Great to drink.

750ml bottle, as Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection. Orangey gold colour, white foam head and aroma of citrus rind & funk. Taste is malt & grain, fruity, lemon rind, funky and dry tannic. Foamy mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry funky finish. Very drinkable.

Look: yellow hazy, sparkling white head.

Aroma: lactic, wild, baked apples, sweet malt.
Taste: moderate sourness, subtle malt sweetness.
Palate is slightly oily.
Flavour has light spicy ethers, cloves.

Bottle (750ml):Golden, hazy, big loose n stable white head; moderate to solid sour cidery and apple-vinegar-like nose, yeast and cellary (maybe with the certain amount of "horse-blanket ") aromas well detectable; moderate to solid sour (lemony) flavour, a certain residual sweetness is hard to detect, quite soft by Gueuze standards, a bit fizzy and medium bodied; cidery and lemony finish with a good tartness in the aftertaste. Well made stuff...

Bottle 75cl, a cloudy golden-copper beer with huge head and good retention which is rare for a gueuze. Nose is on agrumes, moss, typical lambic yeast, light acid touch. Aroma is on apricot, peppery hops notes, yes green apple and especially the apple skin, not as dry as suggested on the label, finish on sour and crudité notes.

Bottle from Berts bierhuis in utrecht. Cork popped off forcefully. Aromas of green apples, hay, funk, some wood. Tastes of citrus, dry apple skins, lemon rind. High carbonation makes for an intense start but quick dry finish.

Tåkete gul farge med masse hvitt luftig skum. Lukter av eple, citrus og hvitvin.
Får litt musserende følelse i smak. God syrlig avslutning.

Pours amber, small head.
Nose shows lemon, elderflower, funk, apple and pear.
Flavours include elderflower, funk, lemon rind and grapes.
Carbonation is crazy high.

75cl bottle at home as Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection. Somewhat hazy orange / golden with a medium white soapy head. Nice combination of sour, sweet and bitter tones. Citrus, oak, tart, malts, grape and some fruit. Very nice.
Bottiglia. Colore ambrato chiaro con un cappello di schiuma mediamente persistente. Aroma maltato e citrico, al palato è molto secca con una durata abbastanza lunga sul palato.

7%ABV. Gueuze.

Poured out a cloudy rusty color. 10ºSRM.

Nose has acetic with a very light dank straw funk. There are also woody, dusty, dry cement and plaster like aromas. There is a pleasant fruit blossom floral dimension to the nose.

Mouthfeel is like a dry sparkling wine. Carbonation is good. Palate has pale malt which is balanced by a dryness and some mild bitterness, just like youd expect of a nice dry champagne or prosecco. There is also a pleasant fresh green spice dimension to the palate like capsicum.

Finish is woody and dry.

Goes on Favorites List !
Pours hazy, looks creamy with a bit of white foam. Aroma is autumny, citric and like applecake. Nicely executed gueuze, very dry and drinkable.

En Boon/Mikkeller bone dry selcetion flaska. En riktigt bra geuze. Kraftfull som en mariage parfait men lite torrare. Torr, stram, lite funkig, fat, lätt sötma som bär smak av druvor, jäst, citrus, citron och äpple och som i kombination med den rejäla syran funkar riktigt bra. Mycket gott.
SAMPLE at a tasting as Boon Black Label. Hazy golden, diminishing head. Unripe fruit and lactic acidity, quite a bit of honey-ish residual sweetness and a distinct nutty toasty note. Very nice.
Smells of sour vegetables and some spices. An evident yet not extreme sourness in the taste. Very effervescent and refreshing beer, a true classic for the style.
High, but fast fading head. Hazy, golden. Smells vinegar and some bacon. Medium body, ticking carbonation. Tastes crispy bacon with some bread and cheese. Great balance, no sharp edges.
Flaska från Bishops Örebro. Disig, halmgul med vit skumkrona. Doft av citrus och lätt vitvinsvinäger.Smak av detsamma. Mkt krispig och rund syrlig kropp.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Wszyscy je juz mieli, wiec czemu nie ja :) zaskakujaco duzo piany, wysokie wysycenie, od cholery owocow w aromacie (winogrona? Cytryna? Agrest? Wszystko niedojrzale). Sporo calkiem przyswajalnej stajni. Takiej spoconej milo. W ustach bardzo lekkie, dosc wytrawne, srednio kwasne znow owocowo choc kiszonka tez sie przewija, octu nie odnotowalem. Jezyk nie dretwieje :)Jak popijac tym tradycyjna salatke jarzynowa, to odczucie duzo kwasniejsze i zmywa smak saltki - to chyba kiepski food pairingO dziwo kojarzy mi sie nie tylko z innymi lambikami, ale tez z saisone fantome, tyle, ze przypraw brak. Bardzo rzeskie, odswiezajace, Bdb+Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Geuze Boon - Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection by Brouwerij Boon at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaJest dziwny. Ma cos dziwnego, jakby klej, gume... Owoce tez. Ryli spoko, ale chyba ciut wile boonaRami Rami is drinking an Oude Geuze Boon Black Label Second Edition by Brouwerij Boon at PowiśleBardzo owocowy, winogronowy, skorzany lambikiwo fajnie, prawie bez tanin, kwasnosc tez owocowa, mi bardziej niz 1sza ed. - klasaOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

gedronken op OIBF 2016. geeloranje met een bescheiden witte kraag. Mooie geur en smaak brett, citrus, champagne, maar ook muf en erg droog. Enige minpuntje was de overdaad aan CO2, zonder dat had hij nog net iets lekkerder geweest.

Gedronken tijdens IPA/Sour proeverij bij de Vinotake, als Boon/Mikkeller Bone Dry. Uitgeschonken in een Struise BD proefglas. Fraaie licht troebele oranje kleur, met een sprankelende snel verdwijnende witte schuimkraag. Droge en frisse aroma's van sinaasappel, limoen, hooi, Brett gist, paardendeken, witte wijn, champagne. Zeer levendige carbonatie, zurige droge en vineuze smaak, haast champagne achtig. Met tonen van limoen, eikenhout, groene appels, gras, paardendeken en leer. Mooie complexe Geuze, behoorlijk zuur, maar ook zeer verfrissend, met een licht hopbitter smaak van grapefruit voor de balans in de afdronk. Een prachtig product, van Brouwerij F. Boon. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

En Boon/Mikkeller bone dry selcetion flaska. En riktigt bra geuze. Kraftfull som en mariage parfait men lite torrare. Torr, stram, lite funkig, fat, lätt sötma som bär smak av druvor och äpple och som i kombination med den rejäla syran funkar riktigt bra. Mycket gott.

From bottle at Oedipus International Beer Festival 2016. Aroma is tart fruits, lots of oaky notes, Bretty funk, barnyard, citrus, Flavour is a nice medium sour with a really dry finish. Body is medium. Excellent complex funky fruity bone dry Gueuze!

750 ml bottle to snifter. Bottle dated 26/03/2035. Looks good; a slightly hazy apricot with ample fizzy off-white head and lively carbonation. Smells solid; a nice balance of funk, citrus, cheese, and oak. Tastes like it smells with a pleasantly tart and lively medium-bodied mouthfeel. Good stuff, and a good value.

750 mL bottle. Cork flies off and it gushes immediately. Big white head that lasts forever. Murky orange body. Smells very musty. Dry hay. Oak. Light acidity. Tastes of lemon sourness. Very yeasty. Strong oak. A little bit astringent and grassy in the back end. Medium body. High carbonation. Really nice. Surprisingly good from Boon.

Klar, gyllene djup gul, snyggt lätt gyllene skum. Doft: Jord, citronsyra, pytte små äppelkart, svavel, avklippta trägrenar. Smak: Jord, vinäger, övermogen citron, äppelkart, svavel, jäst, växter. Fresh eftersmak, äppelkart och malt.

Testad på Mellbygatans ölskola. Ljus och grumlig. Smakar som det ska göra, vintoner, gröna äpplen och en rejäl syra. Det drar bak i gommen.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
750ml, caged and corked bottle. Poured a yellow color with a larger sized white head. Citrus, funky, woody/oaky, barnyard, and fruity. Nice medium tart and clean finish.

Mikkeller bone dry bottle shared. Thanks Shuichi! Wonderful gooseberry and white grapefruit, citrusy nose that doesnt quit. Crisp and refreshing with aggressive tartness but light oak notes keep it in check. Refreshing on a hot day. Great stuff.
Deliciously funky with dry and crisp finish. Perfect summer beer. Almost like champagne.

750ml->tulip. Exploding cork as soon as the cage was loosened. My ceiling demands apologies, Boon. Cloudy gold with massive frothy offwhite head. A: funk, citrus, yeast. T: funky yeast and grains. Very drinkable, quite tart. Slightly heavy on the tongue, and leans towards a touch too acidic. Overall excellent.

From 75 cl bottle. Drunken side by side with Boon / Mikkeller Oude Geuze Boon, Bone Dry Mikkeller Selection. Same beer. Aroma is brett. Yellow colour with mostly lasting white head. Light+ acidic taste. Light+ body, dry feel, tart finish.
Shared with Tim @ Dads Day BBQ. Opaque golden, white short lasting foam head. Nice sour aroma and taset, dry aftertaste. Great. (Velp 201606)

duft funk syrlig æble 
smag. citrus lime funk sur tør mellem malt profil med syrlig behagelige noder

Jesus fuck, this must be the holy grail of Boon lambic. Huge dose of white pepper. So much funk and bacterial infections, this was rediculous. Bone dry. Wales, bro. Good luck finding this one on the shelf.

Oude Geuze Boon Mikkeller Bone Dry Selection. Bottle. Cloudy, not much head. Very leathery, dusty. Dry finish, earthy, lots of carbo (cork blasted out). Just a nice, balanced but austere. Nice gueuze.

750ml green corked and caged bottle batch# 60401, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is hazy amber with a large frothy beige head that reduced quickly, leaving no lacing. Aroma of barnyard, green apples, table grapes, leather and lemon zest. Flavours of green apples, table grapes, lemon zest, vanilla, oak wood notes, and a hint of cherries and nuttiness. Taste is light sweet and heavy sour. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and lively carbonation. Boon Oude Geuze Black Label is excellent, a beer that is probably interesting to hold on for a few years and see how it changes (back of the label states these should keep ~9 years). High ABV for a lambic but there is not any hint of alcohol in the taste, also it is refreshingly light on sweetness.

Pours a medium copper orange color with two plus fingers of fizzy foam. Lots of dank basement and wet wood on the nose with hints of citrus and apple. Palate follows with nice carbonation and good focus. Cobwebs, citrus pith, wet wood, leather, apple skins. Dry crisp finish.
Stark karbonisierter, trocken säuerlicher Antrunk. Holznoten, spritzig, sehr trocken werdend. Die runde Säure bleibt dabei eher gering, spät wird der Alkohol erkennbar. 10/11/9/10//11

Bottle courtesy of Mortlach, Rome-Italy. Bright orange color a bit clear, white foam. Nose: lime, sage, new leather. Mouth: gassy, young, a bit yogurt, good potential. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle shared with ippopotamo36. Pours a dark golden color with a fizzy head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, leather, cellar dust. Flavour is citric, tart, medium sour, quite dry. Medium body, high carbonation. Young, but nice. It has a great potential!
Bottle. Hazy amber pour with white head. Aroma is pungent sour with citrus and yeast. Taste is balanced sour with tropical fruit and fresh citrus. Light body and high carbonation.

Pours hazed golden yellow with a moderate white froth. Aroma is lemon, funk and slight vinegar. Taste is tart and puckering. Lemon, lively carbonation, a little funk and yeast. Thanks to Sylvain for this.

Bottle. The Boon / Mikkeller one. Cotteridge Beano v2. Hazy, dark yellow. Loads of fizz creates a big, bubbly, lively head. Nose has a lactic tang. Fusty lemon. Fresh lemon. Notes of almond. Taste is dry, with a lemon juice tang. Far too fizzy, and burp inducing. Dry, tangy finish. Decent, but the carbonation level spoiled things a bit, really.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 As Mikkeller / Boon Oude Gueuze Bone dry Mikkeller selection. Dark yellow, orange colour. High white head. Barnyard, horseblanket, hints of citrusses, hints of vinegar, woody, leathery notes in the aroma. Hints of white wine, horseblanket at first. Sourness, hints of wine in the middle. Leather, hints of oak and some sourness in the end. Refreshing, citrussy, even juicy gueuze. Very well balanced. Nice one!

750ml bottle. As Boon Gueuze Black Label. Bottled 12.04.16. Thank you, Kristiina. Golden yellow colour. Medium white head. Vinegar, barnyard, flowery notes, citrusses and earthiness in the aroma. Fresh and juicy even. Sourness, hints of white wine at the beginning. Rather dry in the middle. Citrussy, sour, slightly vinegary. Rather dry, bit citrussy, not acidic finish. Citrusses, hints of white wine in the aftertaste. Light bodied, well balanced gueuze. Has not developed yet to the level of complexity as the previous one which was a collab with Mikkeller. 

I think yellow labeled Mikkeller version and the Black label are not the same. Of course the first one was a probably vintage from 2015. I am not going to change my opinion.

750 ml bottle. Unclear golden body with a small white head. Aroma is distinct barnyard, Brett, some citric fruit, acid and wood. Flavor is tart and sour, acidic fruit/berries, funky barnyard, lemon, wood, green apples and leather. All in all a true classic Geuze, rather dry and uncompromised one and I really love it this way. Nothing strange or extra to this one, just a clean to the bone Geuze. Fine body and long lasting dry and sour aftertaste. As a probably dry Geuze I find it remarkable well balanced, highly enjoyable.

750mL bottled 3/26/15, drunk 5/21/16.Large white head shows moderately-strong to strong retention atop a burnished copper-golden body. Why do Boons lambic have more color to them than 3F and Cantillon? Well, I know the answer, and I dont care for it.Cork, leather, must, MASSIVE green apple and white grape in the nose with damp hay and mold. Smells just like Boon Gueuze and that is to say, very underwhelming. Why do I want a noseful of cork and green apple? If I wanted to smell acetaldehyde, Id just buy a macro lager....Low on charm, it just smells old already, with none of the brighter, lighter, daintier brett and lacto notes of the better gueuzeries.Flavor follows, with ample, mostly engaging carbonation and a very mild saccharine character. Hay, wheat, cork, leather and more green apple. Just not something Id ever want to drink again given the far inferiority to almost all of the other lambic producers. Hazy orange body. White fizzy head. Citric aroma, lightly of oranges. Very carbonated. Surprisingly lot of citric acids for boon.

Limited edition of Boon Oude Geuze almost entirely made with lambic that was brewed in Frank Boons new brewhouse. Cork popped out of the bottle with a very loud bang even before I was finished removing the muselet, but there is no gushing, just a cloud of vapor escaping from the neck - the genie is out of the bottle, lets say. Very loudly (as in: audibly from a distance) crackling, thick, egg-white, irregular head dissipating quickly, residing over a warm, lightly orangey old gold robe with vivid, champenoise sparkling and an equally divided haze of pale, tiny yeast bits. Musty aroma of all the good lambic qualities, all working well together: dusty cellar, unripe gooseberry, fermenting hay, very old dry white wine, mouldy lemon, damp earth, ureum (not in the least disturbing - in fact, integrated in the whole lambic funkiness as it should be), sour grapes, old cheese, yuzu, dried mushroom, straw, bread crumbs buried somewhere underneath, cava, old furniture, redcurrant and even something weirdly soapy every now and then (and its not the glass, for all clarity...), as well as a delicate hint of vanilla, which I suppose represents the oak tannins. Extremely crisp and spritzy onset, coarse, stinging carbonation, enlivening the palate immediately; citrus acidity comes up strongly, puckering a bit which I am not used to from Boon lambics, but softening after that; all kinds of sour fruit flavours abound, grapefruit, lime, gooseberry, unripe green plum, grape peel, persisting till deep into the throat. In the middle, a supple yet surprisingly filling backbone of soapy wheat and bready barley provide a firm structure; sour yoghurt-like lactic acidity lies underneath the crisp lemon acidity and dries the mouth. This drying effect is aided by the sharp carbonation and indeed, as is apparently the intention, this geuze ends extremely dry, more so than other Boon geuzes (and literally making my mouth water as a result), with a fairly strong drying wood effect and late, deep but very effectively bittering hops at the back. There is a glow of warming alcohol after all this, but it remains so subtle that it does not at all distract from the rest - intrusive alcohol flavour would obviously be a disaster in this case (or in all lambics, for that matter); instead, it adds body and a kind of creamy feeling in the end, which is unexpected but enjoyable enough. The late, earthy, old hop bitterness lasts for a long time but remains deaf, adding only bitterness in balance with the sourness, but no aroma, as is to be expected from a traditional lambic. The unmistakable leathery Brett flavour, present from the start, lingers in the mouth and nose after swallowing the last drop.  This is a great geuze, indeed different from most other Boon products in being notably drier, spritzier and a bit heavier on the tongue. Not one for beginners I think, but I would love to compare this with the regular oude geuze and the Mariage Parfait to see which one stands out - for the time being and to my personal taste, this is probably the most amazing Boon geuze I had so far.  The bottle was empty before I even noticed - fortunately I have a tendency to murder to dissect.  As for that Mikkeller version: I saw it sitting next to this one in the Struise shop in Bruges last week and hesitated to buy it - fortunately I didnt, since I meanwhile found out that both are actually the same.  Not sure what Mikkeller has to do with this geuze, but I dont see the point in using two different labels for it, I guess the Mikkeller version is intended for export to Denmark or something?
